jobs.title: Principal Mine Planner – Autonomy & Innovation Focus
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

Mariana Minerals is pioneering the next era of mining in the United States. As a mission-driven company focused on innovation, safety, and environmental responsibility, we are building one of the first fully autonomous mining operations in the country—designed from day one with automation at its core. We’re not just improving mining; we’re redefining it.

Position Overview

As the Principal Mine Planner, you will lead the development of integrated mine planning strategies that directly support the deployment of autonomous haul trucks, drills, and shovels. You will be at the forefront of a first-of-its-kind transformation in U.S. mining, combining technical excellence with systems thinking and cross-functional leadership. This is a high-impact, career-defining role. The ideal candidate is a strong planner with both technical depth and a forward-looking mindset—someone excited to design not just a mine, but the future of mining.

Key Responsibilities

Mine Planning Leadership

  • Own and deliver short-, medium-, and long-range mine plans that align with production targets, budget constraints, and safety standards.

  • Design pit phases, road networks, and mining sequences tailored for autonomous operation.

Autonomy-Centric Strategy

  • Develop mine layouts, schedules, and operational logic specifically optimized for autonomous fleets and drilling systems.

  • Partner with autonomy engineering teams to define planning parameters that maximize system performance and reliability.

  • Integrate considerations such as communication networks, obstacle management, interaction zones, and redundancy into the mine plan.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

  • Interface with geology, geotech, operations, autonomy vendors, and control systems teams to ensure all stakeholders are aligned.

  • Translate autonomous system requirements into executable plans for engineering and operations teams.

  • Represent mine planning in autonomy-related technology selections, testing, and commissioning.

Innovation & Modeling

  • Use advanced mine design software (Deswik, Hexagon, Leapfrog etc.) to build and iterate dynamic 3D models and simulate operational scenarios.

  • Identify and resolve planning challenges related to fleet interactions, drill coverage, shovel availability, and throughput optimization.

Thought Leadership

  • Champion a novel approach to mining that fuses automation, sustainability, and productivity.

  • Contribute to internal knowledge-building and set new benchmarks for U.S. autonomous mining operations.

  • Mentor junior engineers and planners on advanced techniques and autonomy-readiness.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Mining Engineering or closely related field (Master’s preferred).

  • 7+ years of progressive mine planning experience, including leadership responsibilities.

  • Proven ability to develop detailed mine plans using modern software (Deswik, MinePlan, Vulcan, etc.).

  • Demonstrated success in projects involving autonomous or semi-autonomous mining systems.

  • Excellent communicator with strong project management skills.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in startup or greenfield mine planning environments.

  • Familiarity with fleet management systems (e.g., Modular, Wenco), OEM autonomous platforms (e.g., CAT MineStar, Komatsu AHS).

  • Professional Engineer (P.Eng or equivalent) or eligibility.

What Makes This Role Unique

  • Industry First: Be part of the first fully autonomous mining operation in the U.S.

  • Breakthrough Impact: Design strategies that will influence the future of mining across North America.

jobs.title: Global Health and Safety Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Health & Safety Lead

Location: Flexible, with travel to US and Canadian sites

About Mariana Minerals

Mariana Minerals is a software-first, vertically integrated minerals company on a mission to supply the critical minerals powering modern energy, AI, and defense technologies. We’re reimagining the minerals supply chain by combining deep industry expertise with advanced software, automation, and data-driven decision-making.

Our culture is built on three principles:

  • Extreme Ownership – We take full responsibility for outcomes, relentlessly driving toward solutions.

  • Engineer Out Requirements, then Automate – We simplify, optimize, and then automate for scale.

  • Share Your Legos – We collaborate openly, share knowledge, and empower each other to build bigger, better solutions.

Join us as we build the future of responsible mineral sourcing and supply.

The Role

We are seeking a company-wide Health & Safety Lead to design, implement, and lead our safety strategy across all departments. Reporting directly to the COO, you will build safety programs from the ground up for new greenfield sites, standardize best practices across existing facilities, and embed a proactive safety culture across the organization.

The ideal candidate combines deep OSHA and MSHA expertise with experience digitizing safety systems, and a hands-on, collaborative approach to partnering with operations teams—from project design to commissioning to steady-state operations.

What You’ll Do

  • Develop and implement a comprehensive safety management system across all Mariana operations (initial focus: US and Canada).

  • Design safety programs for greenfield project sites that meet or exceed OSHA and MSHA regulations.

  • Standardize and harmonize safety processes and policies across all facilities.

  • Lead safety initiatives at headquarters, including the lab and pilot plant.

  • Partner closely with site safety leads to ensure consistent execution.

  • Drive digitization of safety processes—incident reporting, training records, audits, compliance tracking—in collaboration with our software team.

  • Conduct and oversee risk assessments (e.g., HAZOPs), hazard analyses, and job safety analyses.

  • Integrate safety into engineering, construction, and operations workflows.

  • Develop and roll out a company-wide safety training program.

  • Coach managers, supervisors, and employees on safety standards and best practices.

  • Monitor regulatory changes and ensure timely compliance updates.

  • Establish KPIs and reporting frameworks to track safety performance.

  • Serve as primary contact with safety regulators, contractors, and key stakeholders.

  • Initially function as an individual contributor, with the potential to lead a safety team as we grow.

What You Bring

  • Proven track record of building proactive safety cultures and achieving measurable safety improvements.

  • 10+ years of progressive safety experience in chemical, industrial, refining, mining, or heavy construction environments.

  • Leadership experience in safety management strongly preferred.

  • Deep knowledge of OSHA and MSHA regulations, applied in real-world operations.

  • Experience developing safety programs for new facilities or greenfield projects.

  • Proficiency in implementing and managing digital safety systems.

  • Excellent communication, leadership, and influencing skills across all levels.

  • Willingness to travel regularly to project sites in the US and Canada.

Why Join Us?

At Mariana Minerals, you’ll have the opportunity to set the gold standard for safety in a company that values innovation, ownership, and collaboration. Your work will directly shape our culture, protect our people, and support our mission to deliver critical minerals responsibly and efficiently.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Mariana Minerals

Mariana Minerals is a software-first, vertically integrated minerals company on a mission to supply the critical minerals powering modern energy, AI, and defense technologies. We’re reimagining the minerals supply chain by combining deep industry expertise with advanced software, automation, and data-driven decision-making.

Join us as we build the future of responsible mineral sourcing and supply.

Role Overview

Mariana Minerals is looking for a highly motivated Full Stack Software Engineer to work on building the critical minerals supply chain to support the world’s energy transition.

As a Full Stack Software Engineer at Mariana Minerals, you will lead the development and deployment of software to accelerate the engineering and construction of physical infrastructure that is critical to building the minerals supply chain. Responsibilities will include building integrations with the existing software tools for engineering and construction, extending these tools to fill in gaps and address pain points identified by Mariana’s internal engineering and construction teams, working with Mariana’s ML engineers to integrate LLMs to tackle specific challenges around unstructured data ingestion and understanding, and working with Mariana’s internal teams to develop a new “operating system” for the engineering, construction, and operation of Mariana’s mineral processing facilities.

What You’ll Do

  • Work closely with Mariana’s internal engineering, construction, and operations teams to identify and build internal software tools to accelerate the deployment of Mariana’s mineral processing facilities.

  • Build data integrations with the existing suite of engineering/construction tools such as Autodesk.

  • Build net new web experiences and applications that will be used by Mariana's internal teams and partners to help build capital project faster and more efficiently.

  • Evaluate existing software in the ecosystem to assist Mariana’s internal teams

  • Work closely with Mariana’s ML engineers to implement novel LLM powered experiences that assist Mariana’s internal teams.

  • Assist with the data architecture for Mariana’s data pipelines to feed the training of novel ML models that control Mariana’s mineral processing facilities and provide visibility into the operation of the facilities to the internal Mariana team.

What You’ll Bring

  • Strong understanding of software engineering in a professional capacity (1.5+ years preferred).

  • Ability to work with non-software stakeholders to identify pain points and needs, scope level of effort required for new features, and then drive implementation of these features.

  • Self-starter mindset, ability to bring clarity to high ambiguity situations, and excitement to work with non-software stakeholders directly.

  • Ability to work across the entire stack from deploying servers to writing front end code and everything in between (or demonstrated proficiency in one of these areas and the desire to expand your skillset).

jobs.title: Hydrometallurgical Process Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Mariana Minerals

Mariana Minerals is a software-first, vertically integrated minerals company focused on supplying the minerals critical to modern energy, AI, and defense technologies. We are committed to operational excellence, innovation, and building high-performing teams that drive measurable results.

The Opportunity

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Hydrometallurgy Process Engineer to optimize our copper refining operations. This role encompasses the full value chain—from crushing and conveying to heap leaching, solvent extraction (SX), and electrowinning (EW). You will play a pivotal role in driving safety, production efficiency, cost reduction, and team performance at a large-scale operation (12MTPY+ ore production).

As a hands-on engineer, you will champion operational excellence, implement best practices, and foster a high-performance culture across a multidisciplinary team of 30+ professionals in operations, maintenance, and asset management. We are looking for a results-driven Metallurgical Engineer who can demonstrate a proven track record of delivering quantifiable improvements in similar environments.

Key Responsibilities

Operational Leadership & Process Optimization

  • Oversee all aspects of the heap leach operation, including crushing, stacking, leaching, solvent extraction, and electrowinning, ensuring maximum process efficiency and cost-effectiveness.

  • Identify and implement process improvements to enhance recovery rates, reduce downtime, and lower operating costs—backed by specific, quantifiable examples (e.g., increased PLS grade, reduced acid consumption, improved stacking methodology).

  • Lead plant expansions, debottlenecking projects, and greenfield developments, demonstrating clear ROI (e.g., increased throughput, reduced maintenance costs).

  • Optimize leach pad management (lift height, irrigation rates, aeration) to maximize copper recovery and minimize operational risks.

Safety & Compliance

  • Foster a zero-harm culture, with a track record of safety program enhancements (e.g., reduced TRIFR, improved near-miss reporting, behavioral-based safety initiatives).

  • Ensure full compliance with environmental, health, and safety regulations across all leaching and processing activities.

Maintenance & Asset Management

  • Drive reliability-centered maintenance (RCM) strategies, with examples of predictive/preventive maintenance reducing downtime or extending asset life.

  • Oversee maintenance planning and execution to minimize production impact (e.g., optimized crusher liner changes, conveyor belt replacements).

  • Demonstrated experience with fixed plant maintenance, asset management systems (SAP, JDE), and spare parts optimization.

Team Collaboration & Culture Development

  • Lead, mentor, and collaborate with large teams (30+ personnel) across operations, maintenance, and technical services.

  • Provide examples of improving workforce engagement, such as:

  • Implementing performance-based incentives that boosted productivity.

  • Resolving labor inefficiencies through training, accountability, or workflow redesign.

  • Cultivating a positive work culture that reduced turnover and improved collaboration.

Required Qualifications & Experience

  • 3+ years in copper heap leach/SX/EW operations, with at least 5 years in leadership roles managing large operations teams.

  • Proven track record of delivering measurable improvements—must be able to articulate specific projects where your actions led to:

  • Cost savings (e.g., reduced reagent consumption, lower maintenance spend)

  • Production increases (e.g., higher PLS grades, improved stacking rates)

  • Safety improvements (e.g., reduced incidents, better compliance)

  • Experience in greenfield/brownfield expansions, crushing/conveying optimization, or leach pad design is highly desirable.

  • Strong financial acumen with the ability to justify capital projects and demonstrate clear payback periods.

  • Exceptional communication and leadership skills, with a history of building high-performing teams.

Desired Skills

  • Proficiency in lean mining, Six Sigma, or continuous improvement methodologies.

  • Familiarity with planning software and ERP systems (SAP, Pronto).

Why Join Mariana Minerals?

  • Lead a high-impact operation with direct influence on profitability and growth.

  • Thrive in a dynamic, results-driven environment where innovation is recognized and rewarded.

  • Enjoy competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits, and significant career growth potential.

Application Requirement

Please provide specific examples of past achievements (with metrics) in your resume or cover letter.

Ready to make a measurable impact? Apply now and help shape the future of critical minerals with Mariana Minerals.

jobs.title: Mine Manager, Surface Operations
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Mariana Minerals

Mariana Minerals is a software-first, vertically integrated minerals company focused on supplying the minerals critical to modern energy, AI, and defense technologies. We are committed to operational excellence, safety, and innovation across all aspects of our business.

Position Overview

We are seeking a dynamic and results-oriented Mine Manager to lead all aspects of our surface mining operations. This pivotal role is responsible for ensuring safe, efficient, and cost-effective production while driving continuous improvement across drilling, blasting, loading, hauling, maintenance, and support functions. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of delivering measurable cost savings, operational efficiencies, and safety enhancements, while fostering a high-performance, collaborative work culture.

This is a hands-on leadership position requiring demonstrated experience in mine expansion, crushing/conveying systems, leach pad stacking, and brownfield & greenfield mine development. The successful candidate will be able to provide specific examples of initiatives that have led to tangible improvements in production, maintenance, operator performance, and personnel development.

Key Responsibilities

Operational Leadership & Cost Efficiency

  • Develop and execute mine plans to achieve production targets while optimizing costs.

  • Lead and document continuous improvement projects (e.g., mine sequencing, haul road design, maintenance strategy changes) with clear ROI and payback periods.

  • Oversee drilling and blasting operations to maximize fragmentation and minimize costs.

  • Manage haulage and loading operations to improve cycle times and reduce operating expenses.

  • Provide specific examples of initiatives that resulted in hard-dollar savings (e.g., improved fleet utilization, reduced downtime, optimized blasting patterns, or fuel efficiency gains).

Maintenance & Fleet Performance

  • Implement preventive and predictive maintenance programs to extend equipment life and reduce repair costs.

  • Demonstrate past successes in reducing maintenance costs (e.g., extended component life, reduced rebuild frequency, improved parts inventory management).

  • Possess detailed knowledge of equipment repairs and maintenance program implementation, including experience working with major OEM equipment vendors and support personnel.

  • Optimize mobile fleet performance through operator training, telematics, and performance benchmarking.

Safety & Compliance

  • Champion a zero-harm culture through visible safety leadership and engagement.

  • Lead safety initiatives that have demonstrably reduced incidents (e.g., behavioral-based safety programs, near-miss reporting improvements, fatigue management).

  • Ensure full compliance with MSHA, OSHA, and environmental regulations.

Team Leadership & Culture Development

  • Lead and develop large, multidisciplinary teams (30+ personnel) across drilling, blasting, hauling, maintenance, and support functions.

  • Build high-performing teams through mentorship, skills development, and incentive structures that drive engagement and results.

  • Foster a positive workforce culture, reducing turnover, improving cross-shift communication, and encouraging employee-led innovation.

  • Lead by example supporting and participating in new technology implementation & testing

Mine Expansion & Capital Projects

  • Drive brownfield and greenfield mine development, including permitting, infrastructure, and commissioning.

  • Lead capital projects (e.g., crusher/conveyor installations, leach pad expansions, fleet upgrades) with a focus on cost control and execution efficiency.

Qualifications & Experience

  • Minimum 10 years of progressive experience in surface mining operations, with at least 5 years in a leadership role managing large teams (30+ employees) at high-production sites.

  • Demonstrated success in delivering operational improvements, cost savings, and safety enhancements.

  • Strong knowledge of mine planning, equipment maintenance, and regulatory compliance.

  • Experience with mine expansion, greenfield development, and capital project execution is highly desirable.

  • Excellent communication, leadership, and team-building skills.

Our Culture & Values

At Mariana Minerals, we believe our people are our greatest asset. We foster a culture of:

  • Innovation: We embrace new technologies and creative problem-solving to stay at the forefront of the industry.

  • Collaboration: We work together across disciplines and backgrounds, valuing diverse perspectives and open communication.

  • Integrity: We hold ourselves to the highest ethical standards in all our operations and relationships.

  • Safety: We are committed to a zero-harm workplace, prioritizing the well-being of our team and the communities where we operate.

  • Sustainability: We are dedicated to responsible resource development and environmental stewardship.

Benefits & Perks

We offer a comprehensive and competitive benefits package, including:

  • Competitive base salary and performance-based bonuses

  • Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance

  • Retirement savings plan with company match

  • Generous paid time off and holiday schedule

  • Relocation assistance (if applicable)

  • Professional development and training opportunities

  • Employee wellness programs

  • Modern, technology-enabled work environment

Growth & Career Development

At Mariana Minerals, we are committed to your professional growth. As part of our team, you will have:

  • Opportunities to lead high-impact projects and drive innovation

  • Access to mentorship from industry leaders and technical experts

  • Clear pathways for advancement within a rapidly growing company

  • Support for continuing education, certifications, and skills development

  • The chance to shape the future of sustainable mining and critical minerals supply

Ready to make a difference?

Apply now to join Mariana Minerals and help shape the future of sustainable mining.

jobs.title: Machine Learning Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role Overview

Mariana Minerals is looking for a highly motivated Machine Learning Engineer to work on building the critical minerals supply chain.

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Mariana Minerals, you will lead the development and deployment of ML models to control the operation of Mariana’s mineral refining facilities and apply LLMs to accelerate the engineering and construction of physical infrastructure that is critical to the minerals supply chain. Responsibilities will include developing and training ML models of the various chemical operations in Mariana’s mineral processing facilities, training and deploying RL models to control the operations of Mariana’s mineral processing facilities (no robotics required), building data preprocessing, training, and validation pipelines, and applying LLMs to parse unstructured data to assist Mariana’s internal engineering and construction teams.

What You’ll Do

  • Work closely with Mariana’s internal process chemistry teams to develop novel data driven models of key chemical unit operations.

  • Use data from physically realistic simulators to pretrain RL control algorithms and work with subject matter experts to debug and understand gaps between expected model performance and actual performance.

  • Work with Mariana’s internal teams to incorporate data from inline sensors and instruments to improve model performance.

  • Work closely with Mariana’s software engineers to implement novel LLM powered experiences that assist Mariana’s internal teams.

  • Assist with the data architecture for Mariana’s data pipelines to feed the training of novel ML models that control Mariana’s mineral processing facilities and provide visibility into the operation of the facilities to the internal Mariana team.

What You’ll Bring

  • Strong understanding of ML fundamentals and ability to incorporate ideas from research into novel production applications.

  • Demonstrated ability to develop and deploy ML models in production settings (2+ years preferred).

  • Self-starter mindset, ability to bring clarity to high ambiguity situations, and excitement to work with subject matters experts in mechanical, chemical, and process engineering.

  • Ability to work across the entire stack from data pipelines to model inference and monitoring and everything in between (or demonstrated proficiency in one of these areas and the desire to expand your skillset).

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role Overview

Mariana Minerals is looking for a highly motivated Process Controls Engineer to work on building the critical minerals supply chain.

As the Process Controls Engineer at Mariana Minerals, you will lead the development and deployment of first-of-its-kind chemical refining processes, while also playing a critical role in the development of software for capital project execution and automated plant optimization. Responsibilities will include leading equipment and plant-wide controls infrastructure and programming scopes from concept through to design, installation, commissioning, ramp, and handover to the operations team, and supporting the buildout of an in-house engineering team.

What You’ll Do

  • Develop standards for controls programming

  • Lead equipment scopes from concept and modeling validation, through procurement, engineering, fabrication, installation, commissioning, and ramp

  • Manage external equipment providers, technology licensors, and engineering companies to deliver fully integrated and functional mineral refining scopes

  • Drive cross-functional teams of lab technicians, pilot plant engineers, process engineers, and project engineers to lead the technical equipment scale-up and de-risk the commercialization of novel mineral refining processes

  • Support the hiring, mentorship, and day-to-day management of junior process engineers

  • Develop technoeconomic models of new project opportunities, acquisition targets, and new technologies to inform business development

  • Prepare and present bankable engineering deliverables to support project financing partners due diligence reviews

  • Strong understanding of engineering fundamentals and demonstrated ability to leverage the understanding to solve challenging problems

  • Brownfield equipment modifications and upgrades

  • Greenfield equipment design

  • Evaluation and optimization of operating equipment

  • Experience with the following industries and/or production environments:

  • Industrial manufacturing

  • Large-scale mining or mineral processing

  • Large-scale chemical production processes

  • Engineering, procurement, and construction firms

  • Experience with direct or indirect leadership of engineers and technicians

  • Experience with project management and execution of medium to large scale (>$5M) capital projects

jobs.title: Geotechnical Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Overview

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Geotechnical Engineer to join our team in supporting mining project development and operations. This role will be critical in providing geotechnical expertise across the project life cycle—from exploration and feasibility studies to construction and operations. You will work cross-functionally with geology, civil, environmental, and mine planning teams to ensure safe and efficient ground engineering solutions.

Key Responsibilities

Site Investigation & Characterization

  • Plan and execute geotechnical site investigations, including borehole drilling, test pits, sampling, and in-situ testing.

  • Interpret and analyze geotechnical data to develop ground models and support engineering design.

  • Coordinate and oversee laboratory testing programs for soil and rock mechanics.

Design & Analysis

  • Conduct slope stability assessments (open pit and waste dumps), foundation design, and retaining structure evaluations.

  • Develop and review geotechnical designs for mine infrastructure, including haul roads, embankments, tailings storage facilities (TSFs), and underground excavations.

  • Perform geotechnical modeling using software (e.g., Rocscience suite, PLAXIS, FLAC, Slide).

Risk Management & Compliance

  • Support geohazard identification and risk assessments, including seismicity, ground movement, and water-related instabilities.

  • Contribute to geotechnical risk registers and mitigation strategies throughout project phases.

  • Ensure designs and recommendations comply with industry standards and regulatory requirements.

Monitoring & Support

  • Implement and interpret geotechnical instrumentation and monitoring programs.

  • Provide construction support and geotechnical oversight during earthworks, tailings facility construction, and pit/underground development.

  • Respond to geotechnical issues in real time with practical engineering solutions.

Reporting & Collaboration

  • Prepare technical reports, memos, and design documents for internal and external stakeholders.

  • Present findings and recommendations to project teams and management.

  • Collaborate with consultants, contractors, and regulatory agencies as required.

Qualifications

Education

  • Bachelor's degree in Geotechnical, Geological, Civil Engineering or related field.

  • Master’s degree with geotechnical specialization (preferred).

Experience

  • 3–8 years of relevant geotechnical experience in the mining or heavy civil industry.

  • Experience in open pit, underground mining, or tailings storage facility projects is strongly preferred.

Skills & Tools

  • Strong analytical and technical writing skills.

  • Proficient with geotechnical software (e.g., GeoStudio, Rocscience, FLAC, Leapfrog).

  • Familiar with GIS and 3D modeling tools (ArcGIS, Surpac, Deswik is a plus).

  • Ability to work independently and in field environments.

Preferred Certifications

  • Professional Engineer (P.E./P.Eng) or working towards registration.

  • Mine Safety certifications (e.g., MSHA, First Aid) a plus.

Work Conditions

  • Mix of office and field/site work depending on project phase.

  • May involve remote fieldwork and occasional travel to mining sites.

jobs.title: Metallurgy Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Mariana Minerals is looking for a highly motivated Metallurgist to work on building back the domestic critical minerals supply chain.

As a Metallurgist at Mariana, you’ll play a critical role in supporting and optimizing our mineral processing operations across a range of unit processes, including heap leaching, solvent extraction and electrowinning (SX/EW), flotation, crushing, and milling. You’ll work closely with operations, technical services, and project development teams to ensure high metal recoveries, efficient reagent use, and safe, compliant plant operations. This is a site-based role with regular exposure to both fieldwork and metallurgical analysis. Expect a fast-paced, hands-on environment where your contributions directly influence production and growth.

What You’ll Do

Optimize Metallurgical Processes - Monitor and improve metallurgical performance across heap leach pads, SX/EW plants, flotation circuits, and comminution areas (crushing/milling). Identify bottlenecks, troubleshoot issues, and implement improvements to enhance throughput and recovery.

Design and Execute Test Program - Plan and supervise metallurgical testwork (e.g., column leach tests, flotation tests, grinding studies). Interpret results to support operational changes or project decisions.

Track and Report Metallurgical Performance - Conduct routine sampling, analysis, and metallurgical accounting. Maintain accurate records of metallurgical balances, recoveries, and plant efficiency metrics. Prepare internal reports and contribute to monthly technical summaries.

Collaborate Across Teams - Work with operations, maintenance, and geology teams to integrate metallurgical insights into daily decision-making. Provide input to capital projects, equipment selection, and commissioning activities.

Champion Safety and Compliance - Promote a strong safety culture and ensure that all metallurgical work aligns with environmental, health, and regulatory standards.

What You'll Bring

  • 3–7 years of experience in mineral processing, ideally with exposure to both hydrometallurgical and flotation circuits.

  • Strong understanding of heap leach dynamics, SX/EW systems, flotation chemistry, and comminution fundamentals.

  • Skilled in metallurgical test design, data analysis, and performance optimization.

  • Experience with metallurgical modeling and software tools such as METSIM, HSC, or similar process modeling software package

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities.

  • Excellent communication skills—able to translate technical findings into actionable recommendations.

  • Proactive, safety-conscious, and results-driven, with a collaborative mindset.

  • Ability to thrive in a field-based, production-focused environment.

POSITION DESCRIPTION:

 The Mariana Minerals Electrician will provide competent and effective electrical support to our Refinery operations in East Texas. Our Electrician will be primarily responsible for maintaining, repairing, testing, adjusting, and assisting in the installation and removal of all electrical, communication, control, and measurement equipment at assigned locations. Our Electrician will perform a variety of operations, maintenance, and construction tasks to maintain safe operations of the refinery and its related facilities all while ensuring the facility is operated and maintained in compliance with company and applicable regulatory standards and practices.

 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES: 

  • Understand how to read and translate the information found within building and process blueprints and one-line diagrams to install outlets, circuits, load centers and other forms of electrical equipment

  • After installing the electrical equipment, test all connections to ensure all components are working properly and safely.

  • Troubleshoot and diagnose electrical issues in industrial equipment and processes using experience, system knowledge and proper instruments appropriate to the voltages and currents encountered.

  • Perform preventive maintenance on electrical systems to include disassembly, cleaning, reassembly, and calibration.

  • Meet and follow local, state and national electrical codes.

  • Communicate with management, engineers, mechanics, and equipment operators to advise them if there are any potential electrical hazards.

  • Examine jobs to be done and determine scope and best way to accomplish the work.

  • Ensure the shop is maintained in a safe and orderly fashion. Ensure the safety needs are given a top priority in operations support and work execution.

  • Update the computerized maintenance management system (CMMS) as necessary to maintain accurate plant asset historical records.

  • Have complete knowledge of plant's processes and packaging systems.

  • Protect the integrity and quality of product at all times.

  • Recommend equipment to be included in preventive maintenance programs.

  • Suggest improvements to all maintenance processes, including planning scheduling, preventive maintenance, corrective maintenance, CMMS, storeroom operations, etc.

  • Maintain close contact with assigned maintenance crew, the production supervisor and equipment production operator technicians.

  • Maintain necessary records and files and distributes meaningful and accurate control reports.

  • Complies with DOT and OSHA health, safety and environmental requirements and follows safety philosophy and procedures developed by the Company including: applicable environmental, health and safety rules, procedures, and accepted safe work practices, the use of appropriate personal protective equipment and safety systems, and the reporting of workplace hazards and injury or illness arising from workplace activities; observes the workplace to identify conditions or behaviors that should be corrected and takes appropriate action.

 

QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE: 

 

The qualified candidates will possess a strong combination of knowledge and experience in the following:

  • Skill in the use of hand and power tools of the electrician trade to include a variety of electronic, electrical, or electromechanical test and measurement equipment.

  • Knowledge of safety, environmental, and security regulations, practices, and procedures.

jobs.title: Drill and Blast Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Job Title: Drill & Blast Engineer – Surface Copper Operations
Location: Site-Based - La Sal, UT

Job Summary:
We are seeking a highly analytical and safety-focused Drill & Blast Engineer to design, oversee, and optimize all drilling and blasting activities at our surface heap leach copper mine. This critical role is responsible for ensuring the highest standards of safety, achieving optimal fragmentation for downstream processing, and driving cost-effectiveness through continuous improvement. The ideal candidate will be proficient in advanced blast design, rigorous data reconciliation, and the application of new technologies to enhance performance while strictly adhering to all regulatory requirements.

Key Responsibilities:
1. Blast Design & Optimization

  • Develop, implement, and refine precise blast patterns and charge designs tailored to specific geotechnical domains in both ore and waste zones, utilizing ANFO, emulsions, and bulk delivery systems.

  • Design and optimize blast timing sequences (Nonel/Electronic) to control fragmentation, minimize vibration, and improve diggability.

  • Employ specialized software (e.g., Fragmentation, Design, Vibration modeling) for advanced analysis, rapid reporting, and scenario planning.

  • Lead the reconciliation process of key performance indicators (KPIs), including powder factor, cost per ton, fragmentation analysis, ore dilution, and elevation control to drive design optimization.

2. Drill Program Management

  • Coordinate drill schedules and patterns to ensure strict alignment with both short-term mine plans and long-term strategic goals.

  • Evaluate and manage blast contractors and technology providers to ensure alignment with operational goals, safety standards, and cost-efficiency benchmarks.

  • Supervise drill contractors to ensure compliance with safety standards, design specifications (hole diameter, depth, inclination), and performance metrics.

  • Design and manage drill patterns with a paramount focus on preserving pit wall integrity and ensuring long-term geotechnical slope stability.

  • Work closely with geology teams to coordinate drilling activities across production and exploration, ensuring accurate targeting, data integrity, and alignment with resource models.

  • Generate bills of material for supports, guides, anchors, stops, flex joints, and expansion joints for procurement

  • Perform dynamic analyses, including slug flow, water hammer, and flange leakage checks, using Caesar II

  • Conduct Finite Element Analysis (FEA) for critical vessel junctions using FE Pipe or Nozzle Pro

  • Communicate the impact of stress and vessel analysis on designs and escalate concerns regarding schedules or material lead times

  • Serve as the Subject Matter Expert on piping and pressure vessel design, ensuring compliance with ASME and ASTM codes

  • Mentor and guide junior engineers, staff augmentation engineers, and high-value engineering partners

  • Review and approve final design documents, including isometrics, shop drawings, material submittals, and pipe support designs

  • Continuously improve project workflows and standards to ensure consistent, high-quality designs for piping and pressure vessels

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Job Title: Grade Control Geologist – Surface Copper Operations (Utah)

Location: Site-Based - La Sal, UT

Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly motivated and safety-focused Grade Control Geologist to join our dynamic team. This critical role is responsible for the accurate delineation of ore and waste boundaries to maximize ore recovery, minimize dilution, and ensure the highest quality ore feed is delivered to our crushing and heap leach circuit. The successful candidate will leverage technology, rigorous field monitoring, and data analysis to drive operational efficiency and profitability while upholding our unwavering commitment to safety.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Safety & Compliance:

  • Champion a culture of safety excellence, ensuring all activities meet and exceed MSHA regulations and company safety standards.

  • Conduct and document thorough workplace examinations and safety interactions.

  • Actively participate in safety meetings and contribute to hazard identification and mitigation strategies.

2. Ore Control & Delineation:

  • Conduct detailed geologic logging of blast hole cuttings and RC/DD drill samples to define lithology, alteration, and mineralization.

  • Design, implement, and manage the blast hole and verification drilling sampling program, ensuring strict QA/QC protocols are followed.

  • Utilize advanced modeling software (e.g., Vulcan, Leapfrog, Deswik) to create detailed short-range geologic and grade control models.

  • Clearly mark ore/waste boundaries and control elevations in the field for mining operations.

3. Operational Integration & Optimization:

  • Work directly with mine operations, survey, and blasting engineers to ensure drill and blast patterns are executed according to design to maximize ore recovery and minimize dilution.

  • Provide daily ore routing instructions to shovel and load operators and monitor compliance.

  • Supervise ore stacking on the heap leach pad to ensure adherence to grade-specific placement strategies.

4. Data Analysis, Reconciliation & Reporting:

  • Perform detailed monthly reconciliation of production data: blast hole model vs. truck load counts vs. mill feed vs. reserve model.

  • Analyze and report on Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) including, but not limited to:

o Ore Dilution & Ore Loss percentages

o Grade Tonnage Curves and predicted vs. actual metal production

o Total Copper delivered to the crusher (grade and tons)

o Waste tons misclassified as ore and vice-versa

o Crusher throughput and recovery efficiency linked to feed grade

  • Generate daily, weekly, and monthly grade control reports for management.

5. Technology & Continuous Improvement:

  • Proactively explore and recommend new technologies (e.g., hyperspectral scanning, drone photogrammetry, real-time assay tools) to improve the speed and accuracy of ore/waste discrimination.

  • Continuously refine grade control processes and methodologies to enhance efficiency and reduce costs.

Required Skills & Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Geology or related Earth Science field.

  • Minimum of 3+ years of experience in mine geology, with a strong focus on grade control in a surface mining environment.

  • Proven experience with geologic logging, sampling protocols, and QA/QC procedures.

  • Demonstrated proficiency with mining/geology software packages (e.g., Vulcan, Leapfrog, Deswik, Surpac, MS Office).

  • Solid understanding of drilling, blasting, and loading operations and their impact on grade control.

  • Strong analytical skills with experience in production reconciliation and KPI tracking.

  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively lead and instruct operators in the field.

  • Must be a team player with a strong attention to detail and a relentless focus on safety.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience at a heap leach copper operation.

  • Familiarity with GPS and survey systems used for field marking.

  • Experience with process reconciliation and an understanding of metallurgical recovery principles.

  • Strong leadership potential and a desire to advance within the technical team.

Job Description: Senior Grade Control Geologist

Location: Utah, USA

Site: Surface Copper Mine

Reports to: Chief Geologist or Mine Superintendent

Company Overview:

Our company is a leading copper producer committed to safety, operational excellence, and innovation. Our Utah-based surface mining operation utilizes modern drilling, blasting, and hauling techniques to deliver ore to our crushing and heap leach processing circuit. We are seeking an experienced and driven leader to advance our grade control practices and lead our team of dedicated professionals.

Position Summary:

The Senior Grade Control Geologist is a critical leadership role responsible for the technical direction and daily execution of all grade control activities. This individual will lead, mentor, and develop a team of grade control geologists to ensure the safe and optimal delineation of ore and waste. The successful candidate will be a hands-on leader, leveraging their extensive surface mining experience to develop and implement best practices, drive technological adoption, and own the reconciliation process to maximize ore recovery, minimize dilution, and directly contribute to the operation's financial performance.

Key Responsibilities:

Leadership & People Development:

  • Provide direct leadership, mentorship, and technical guidance to the grade control geology team.

  • Foster a culture of safety, accountability, continuous improvement, and collaborative problem-solving.

  • Develop training programs to enhance the team's skills in geological interpretation, software use, and field practices.

Technical Execution & Operational Support:

  • Own the entire blast hole (BH) sampling and modeling process, from collar surveying and sample collection to the construction of the definitive dig-line BH block model.

  • Optimize the use of technology (e.g., RTK GPS, UAV/drone photogrammetry, downhole surveying) for field monitoring, ore contact mapping, and design implementation.

  • Work integrally with Mining Operations and Blasting Engineers to ensure drill and blast patterns are designed and laid out in the field to achieve design parameters, maximize ore recovery, and minimize dilution.

  • Provide clear and timely communication to shovel and loadout operators to guide material movement (ore vs. waste) and destination (crusher vs. waste dump vs. low-grade stockpile).

Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) & Best Practices:

  • Develop, document, and implement comprehensive Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for all grade control activities, including drilling, sampling, assaying, modeling, and field marking.

  • Standardize data collection and management protocols to ensure data integrity and rapid turnaround.

Reconciliation & Performance Analysis:

  • Own and manage the monthly reconciliation process, comparing the BH Block Model vs. Truck Counts (mined) vs. the Reserve Model (planned).

  • Analyze and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify trends, root causes of variance, and opportunities for improvement.

  • Key KPIs include: Ore Dilution (%) & Ore Loss (%), Ore Tons Mined & Grade Delivered to Crusher, Total Material Movement, Planned vs. Actual Design Elevation Control, Copper Recovery (lbs), and Cost per Ton Mined.

Technology & Innovation:

  • Research, evaluate, and champion the implementation of new technologies (e.g., hyperspectral scanning, automated assay labs, real-time ore tracking, advanced modeling software) to improve efficiency, accuracy, and value.

  • Maintain expertise in industry-standard grade control software (e.g., Vulcan, Deswik, Leapfrog, MineSight) and ensure the team is proficient in their use.

Safety:

  • Champion a zero-harm culture. Safety is our absolute priority.

  • Ensure all grade control activities meet and exceed MSHA regulations and company safety standards.

  • Conduct and participate in safety meetings, audits, and risk assessments.

Required Qualifications & Experience:

• Bachelor of Science degree in Geology or a related geoscience field.

• A minimum of 8-10 years of experience in grade control geology, with at least 3-5 years in a leadership or supervisory role at a surface mine.

• Proven, extensive experience in a copper porphyry deposit environment.

• Demonstrable experience developing SOPs and leading a technical team.

• High proficiency in grade control software (e.g., Vulcan, Deswik) for block modeling, mine planning, and design.

• Strong background in blast hole block model construction, validation, and reconciliation.

• In-depth understanding of drilling and blasting processes and their impact on grade control.

• Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with geology, survey, mining engineering, and operations teams.

• Must be physically able to work in all outdoor field conditions on a active mine site.

Desired Qualifications:

• Experience with heap leach operations and understanding of crush-size and leach kinetics as they relate to grade control.

• Experience with ore control systems for multiple ore types or domains (e.g., oxide, transition, sulfide).

• A strong planning background with experience in short-term mine planning.

• Project management experience in implementing new technology or software systems.

jobs.title: Process Modeling Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role Overview

Mariana Minerals is seeking a highly motivated Process Modeling Engineer to support the development of next-generation refining processes for critical minerals — key to enabling the world’s energy transition.

In this role, you will be responsible for developing, validating, and optimizing heat and material balance models using tools such as ASPEN Plus/HYSYS, SysCAD, OLI Studio, or METSIM. You will work closely with R&D, pilot operations, and project execution teams to translate lab and pilot data into robust, scalable process models that drive the design of first-of-a-kind mineral refining facilities.

What You’ll Do

  • Develop steady-state and dynamic process models to establish heat and material balances for integrated mineral refinery systems using ASPEN, SysCAD, OLI, or METSIM.

  • Automate equipment and process sizing (reactors, heat exchangers, filters, crystallizers, evaporators, and separators) based on model outputs, linking models to datasheets and other engineering tools

  • Develop and maintain process simulation databases, ensuring consistency and traceability between modeling assumptions, test data, and engineering deliverables.

  • Calibrate and reconcile models using pilot or plant operating data to ensure model fidelity and predictive accuracy.

  • Conduct process optimization studies — evaluating energy/heat recovery, recycle strategies, and material efficiency improvements.

  • Develop dynamic process models to validate PLC and DCS programming and evaluate/optimize buffer sizing throughout the design.

  • Link process models to CAPEX and OPEX estimation tools, automating technoeconomic model development

  • Document modeling methodologies and results, providing clear technical communication for design reviews, techno-economic assessments, and regulatory submissions.

What You’ll Bring

  • Proficiency in one or more of the following process simulation tools:

  • ASPEN Plus / HYSYS

  • SysCAD

  • OLI Studio / OLI Flowsheet

  • METSIM

  • Deep understanding of mass transfer, heat transfer, thermodynamics, fluid flow, and reaction engineering.

  • Experience developing material and energy balances for multi-step, integrated process systems.

  • Strong grasp of chemical equilibria and phase behavior in aqueous and non-aqueous systems.

  • Familiarity with data reconciliation, parameter fitting, and model validation using experimental or operational data.

  • Competency with Python or MATLAB for model automation, data processing, and custom calculations is a strong plus.

  • Experience integrating process modeling outputs into EPC deliverables (PFDs, P&IDs, equipment datasheets, control narratives, etc.)

jobs.title: Senior Data Engineer, Integrations
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Mariana Minerals

Mariana Minerals is a software-first, vertically integrated minerals company on a mission to supply the critical minerals powering modern energy, AI, and defense technologies.

We’re reimagining how minerals are sourced, refined, and optimized by combining deep industrial expertise with software, automation, and data-driven decision-making. Join us as we build the future of responsible mineral sourcing and supply.

The Opportunity

We’re looking for a Senior Data & Integrations Engineer to own the data platform that connects our industrial systems to ML models—building the semantic layer between process engineering and AI-driven operations.

This role goes beyond traditional ETL. You’ll design and build robust Python-based data pipelines and semantic models that translate real-world industrial processes into structured, meaningful data for our machine learning and software teams. Your work will directly enable reinforcement learning algorithms that control physical equipment—where data engineering meets real-world impact.

What You’ll Do

Core Responsibilities (≈70%)

  • Design, build, and maintain data pipelines in Python that integrate with our digital twin simulator, ML infrastructure, and operational systems.

  • Develop semantic data models and analytics layers that bridge process engineering, ML model requirements, and business metrics.

  • Architect data systems that support both real-time operations and historical analysis, prioritizing semantic accuracy and data quality over massive scale.

  • Evolve our data platform as we scale from our first facility to multiple operations—defining the foundations of a modern, industrial data stack.

  • Partner with ML engineers and process experts to ensure data is clean, consistent, and fit for model training and inference.

Integrations & Cross-Functional Work (≈30%)

  • Build and maintain API integrations with enterprise and industrial systems (PLCs, LIMS, historians, engineering tools).

  • Support real-time data exchange between control systems, dashboards, and analytics platforms.

  • Collaborate across software, process, and ML teams to translate complex operational data into actionable insights.

What You’ll Bring

Required

  • 5+ years of Python development experience, focused on data engineering and modeling.

  • Proven experience creating semantic layers and analytics models bridging technical and business contexts.

  • Strong software engineering fundamentals—version control, testing, documentation, and maintainable code.

  • Hands-on experience with modern data tools (Airflow/Dagster, dbt, data quality frameworks).

  • Clear communication and collaboration skills; ability to work with ML, software, and operations teams.

  • A structured yet creative problem-solving mindset and comfort with ambiguity.

Nice to Have

  • API integration experience (REST, OAuth, rate limiting, retries).

  • Familiarity with time-series or industrial data (PLCs, LIMS, SCADA).

  • Exposure to ML pipelines and real-time data processing.

  • Experience designing data systems in manufacturing, energy, or process industries.

Why This Role Matters

This isn’t a big-data problem—it’s a smart-data challenge. You’ll create the connective tissue between industrial operations and AI systems, turning complex process signals into meaningful data that drives real outcomes.

Your work will directly shape how AI optimizes mineral processing and define the foundation of Mariana’s data strategy as we grow.

Why Join Mariana Minerals

  • Build systems that bridge the physical and digital worlds.

  • Work alongside engineers, data scientists, and industrial experts solving hard problems that matter.

  • Join a culture that values Extreme Ownership, Engineering Out Requirements, then Automating, and Sharing Your Legos.

Be part of building the future of intelligent mineral processing.

Role Overview

Mariana Minerals is looking for an experienced Senior Full Stack Software Engineer to lead critical technical initiatives in building the next-generation critical minerals supply chain to support the world's energy transition.

As a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer at Mariana Minerals, you will architect, lead, and deliver software systems that accelerate the engineering and construction of physical infrastructure critical to building the minerals supply chain. You will drive technical strategy, mentor team members, and own end-to-end delivery of complex systems. Key responsibilities include designing and implementing robust integrations with existing engineering and construction software tools, architecting scalable solutions to address pain points identified by Mariana's internal teams, leading cross-functional collaboration with ML engineers to integrate LLMs for unstructured data challenges, and spearheading the development of a new "operating system" for the engineering, construction, and operation of Mariana's mineral processing facilities.

This is a truly full-stack role where you'll be expected to write production-quality frontend code while also demonstrating deep understanding of system design and backend architecture. You'll move seamlessly between user interfaces and distributed systems, ensuring excellence at every layer of the stack.

What You'll Do

  • Lead the technical design and architecture of internal software tools, ensuring scalability, reliability, and maintainability while working closely with engineering, construction, and operations teams.

  • Architect and implement complex data integrations with enterprise engineering/construction tools such as Autodesk, establishing best practices for API design and data synchronization.

  • Drive the development of sophisticated web applications and platforms used by internal teams and partners, making key technical decisions on frameworks, infrastructure, and deployment strategies.

  • Conduct thorough technical evaluations of third-party software solutions, providing strategic recommendations on build-vs-buy decisions and integration approaches.

  • Lead cross-functional initiatives with ML engineers to design and implement production-ready ML, RL, and LLM-powered features, ensuring robust error handling and scalable architecture.

  • Mentor junior engineers, conduct code reviews, and establish engineering best practices across the team.

  • Participate in technical strategy discussions and contribute to long-term technology roadmap planning.

  • Own production reliability and performance optimization for critical systems.

What You'll Bring

  • 5+ years of professional software engineering experience with a proven track record of delivering complex, production systems.

  • Deep expertise across the full stack, with demonstrated ability to make architectural decisions spanning frontend frameworks, backend services, databases, and cloud infrastructure.

  • Strong experience translating business requirements from non-technical stakeholders into robust technical solutions, with ability to communicate complex technical concepts clearly.

  • Proven leadership experience, whether through formal management, technical lead roles, or driving cross-functional initiatives.

  • Excellence in system design and architecture, with experience in distributed systems, microservices, and event-driven architectures.

  • Track record of working in ambiguous, fast-paced environments and bringing structure to complex technical challenges.

  • Experience with modern web frameworks (React/Vue), backend technologies (Node.js/Python/Go), and cloud platforms (AWS/GCP).

  • Strong understanding of DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and infrastructure as code.

  • Experience with data engineering, ETL pipelines, or ML/AI integration is a plus.

  • Startup experience in a rapidly scaling company is helpful but not required.

  • Domain experience in manufacturing, industrial automation, or capital projects is beneficial but not required.

About Mariana Minerals

Mariana Minerals is a software-first, vertically integrated minerals company on a mission to supply the critical minerals powering modern energy, AI, and defense technologies. We’re reimagining the minerals supply chain by combining deep industry expertise with advanced software, automation, and data-driven decision-making. Join us as we build the future of responsible mineral sourcing and supply.

What You’ll Do

As a Construction Manager at Mariana Minerals, you’ll lead the planning, coordination, and execution of multiple large-scale, fast-paced industrial construction projects — from design through commissioning. You’ll oversee field operations, manage contractors, control budgets, and ensure that each project is delivered safely, on time, and within scope.

This is a hands-on leadership role that requires adaptability, strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to collaborate across disciplines to deliver high-performance facilities that support Mariana’s ambitious mission.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead, coordinate, and supervise all on-site construction activities across multiple concurrent projects.

  • Develop and execute project plans, construction schedules, and logistics strategies for materials, equipment, and manpower.

  • Oversee trade contractors and vendor installations to ensure quality, safety, and compliance with specifications and building codes.

  • Manage overall project delivery, including design-build and self-performed scopes.

  • Identify and mitigate potential risks, resolving issues quickly to maintain schedule integrity.

  • Partner with Project Management, Engineering, and Procurement teams to track progress, budgets, and cost performance.

  • Perform inspections, oversee quality control, and coordinate commissioning and safety reviews.

  • Maintain proactive communication with key stakeholders, management, and site personnel.

  • Foster a culture of safety and quality through compliance with OSHA, NFPA 70E, and all relevant regulations.

  • Promote continuous improvement, transparent reporting, and alignment across functions.

What You’ll Bring

  • Bachelor’s degree in construction management, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent practical experience).

  • 6+ years managing large commercial or industrial construction projects, including field supervision.

  • Proven background in civil, structural, architectural, mechanical, electrical, life safety, and controls systems.

  • Experience as a Superintendent or Project Manager on industrial facility construction or brownfield/renovation projects.

  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Project, Bluebeam, and cost analysis tools.

  • Strong working knowledge of building codes, NFPA 70E, NEC requirements, and environmental regulations.

  • OSHA 30, NFPA 70E, and First Aid/CPR certifications (or willingness to obtain).

  • Excellent communication, presentation, and leadership skills with the ability to lead diverse teams.

  • A proactive, solutions-driven mindset and the ability to thrive under tight timelines.

  • Willingness to work on-site and engage directly with field operations.

Why Join Mariana Minerals

  • Be part of a mission-driven team transforming how critical minerals are sourced and refined.

  • Work at the intersection of industrial innovation and advanced technology.

  • Shape large-scale projects with lasting impact on clean energy and AI infrastructure.

  • Collaborate with world-class engineers, operators, and builders.
